title: What time is the final of Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions on ITV tonight?
text:
Who’ll be crowned the ultimate Britain’s Got Talent champion? (Picture: Syco/Thames/ITV)

Britain’s Got Talent is set to crown its ultimate winner as the final of spin-off series Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions airs tonight.

The past five weeks’ worth of shows have seen 10 acts from all across the world make it through, with five landing Golden Buzzers from the judges and Ant and Dec, the others chosen by a group of BGT ‘superfans’ in the audience.

The line-up includes acts from the US, Canada and Germany as well as some BGT favourites, all competing to be crowned champion of champions.

It’s set to be a must-watch for fans of the show – but what time does it all kick off?

Here’s what you need to know…

What time is the final of Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions on ITV tonight?

Bello and Anneliese Nock will bring their daredevil act back to the stage for the final (Picture: ITV)

The final of Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions kicks off on ITV on Saturday night at 8.30pm.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The show runs for two hours ahead of The Jonathan Ross Show at 10.30pm – with the winner due to be crowned just before the end of the show.

If you’ve missed any of the previous instalments you can catch up via the ITV Hub.

Who is competing in the final of Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions?

MerseyGirls will also be returning to the stage (Picture: ITV)

These are the acts who’ll be taking to the stage on Saturday night’s show.

Alexa Lauenberger (performing dog act, winner of Germany’s Das SuperTalent in 2017)

Bars and Melody (singing duo, finalists in Britain’s Got Talent 2014)

Bello and Anneliese Nock (father-daughter daredevil duo, America’s Got Talent 2017 and 2018)

Darcy Oake (Canadian magician, finalist in Britain’s Got Talent 2014)

Kseniya Simonova (sand artist, winner of Ukraine’s Got Talent 2009)

Stavros Flatley (father-son dance duo, finalists in Britain’s Got Talent 2009)

MerseyGirls (dance troupe, Britain’s Got Talent 2017)

Paddy and Nicko (dance duo, finalists in Britain’s Got Talent 2014)

Preacher Lawson (comedian, finalist in America’s Got Talent 2017)

Twist and Pulse (dance duo, finalists in Britain’s Got Talent 2010)

MORE: Britain’s Got Talent’s Stavros Flatley defiantly insist they’re staying together despite split rumours
description: Britain's Got Talent: The Champions has reached its final, with 10 acts competing for the ultimate accolade - but what time should you tune in?
